document_data.name: Sorcery Crow
document_data.mainbody: '''Sorcery crows''' were red-feathered [[songbird]]s with the ability to see into the [[Weave]]. These creatures were often kept as alarms that detected magic effects.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|35-36}}{{Cite adventurers league/Drums of the Dead/Book 2|13-14}}{{Cite adventurers league/Drums of the Dead/Book 3|4}}
document_data.Description: A sorcery crow resembled a scarlet red [[crow]] with glowing eyes.
document_data.Behavior: When trained to do so, sorcery crows squawked whenever they detected magic within a {{SI|50|ft}} radius. Some sorcery crows were trained to only do so within a range of {{SI|10|ft}}.
document_data.History: In the late 14{{th}} century, sometime after the destruction of the ''[[Soulmonger]]'', the [[Red Wizards of Thay]]-operated [[Crawling Palace of Ras Nsi]] used sorcery crows as part of its defenses.
document_data.Notable Sorcery Crows:
Mother [[Sibonseni]], [[Waukeen]]ar high priestess of the [[Hall of Gold]] in [[Port Nyanzaru]], kept sorcery crows in the entry hall of her villa.

While stationed in the ruins of [[Mezro]], Flame [[Brokenbarrel]] of the [[Flaming Fist]] kept a sorcery crow as security.
